sentences.en: Although disabled by polio during the Second World War, Proctor was also a first-rate helmsman.
sentences.cn: 二战期间尽管身患小儿麻痹症，普罗克特仍不失为一流的舵手。

sentences.en: Children have been routinely immunized against polio since 1958.
sentences.cn: 自从1958年以来,儿童都按照常规接种防治小儿麻痹症的疫苗.

sentences.en: Gladys was crippled by polio at the age of 3.
sentences.cn: 格拉迪丝3岁时因小儿麻痹症腿瘸了。

sentences.en: He dragged a foot when he walked, a leftover from polio.
sentences.cn: 他走路时一瘸一拐的，那是小儿麻痹的后遗症。

sentences.en: He was crippled by polio as a child.
sentences.cn: 他幼年患过小儿麻痹症，结果腿就瘸了。

sentences.en: He wore leg braces after polio in childhood.
sentences.cn: 他幼时得过小儿麻痹症后双腿安上了支架。

sentences.en: Polio has been virtually eradicated in Brazil.
sentences.cn: 在巴西脊髓灰质炎实际上已经根除。

sentences.en: Polio was then endemic among children my age.
sentences.cn: 那时小儿麻痹症在我这个年纪的孩子中很常见。

sentences.en: She had polio as a child and spent the rest of her life in a wheelchair.
sentences.cn: 她小时候得了小儿麻痹症,终生没离开过轮椅.

sentences.en: She was struck down by polio at the age of four.
sentences.cn: 她四岁那年因小儿麻痺症死去.
她因患小儿麻痹症而瘸了.

sentences.en: The polio vaccine has saved millions of lives.
sentences.cn: 脊髓灰质炎疫苗挽救了数以百万计的生命.

sentences.en: The Salk Vaccine greatly reduces the number of polio cases.
sentences.cn: 索克疫苗极大地减少了患病人数.

sentences.en: Then disaster struck in August 1921, when an attack of polio laid Roosevelt low.
sentences.cn: 1921年8月,罗斯福大难临头, 脊髓灰质炎损害了他的健康.

sentences.en: Tremendous progress has been made toward ending polio worldwide.
sentences.cn: 在迈向终结全世界小儿?痹的目标上,我们已获得重大进展.

words.tran_cn: 小儿麻痹症（等于poliomyelitis）；脊髓灰质炎

trans.tran_en: a serious infectious disease of the nerves in the  spine  , that often results in someone being permanently unable to move particular muscles
